intro: Mascarenhasia micrantha, commonly known as the Mascarene starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant is herbaceous, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in coastal environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
